entry.title: Stamp Collection
entry.content:
Several years ago, maybe somewhere around 2000, I got into collecting stamps as a hobby. I digitized them in 2018, set them up in a ‘gallery’ in 2020 and eventually with all things digital, lost track of them. I’ve sort of revived that collection here, since this is one space I frequent more often. Around 2018, I also handed over my physical collection to Mummyjaan. Not quite sure if she’s actively maintaining it.

entry.title: Coin Collection
entry.content:
Over the last few years M&I have been collecting coins as we’ve moved across different posts. These MSG coins are real cool and are one of the ways the marines raise funds for the Marine ball. Not quite sure until when we’ll collect these but I did want to digitize them. Only a question of time that we start losing/gifting them.

2025 MSG 250th Marine Ball coin

This one looks pretty tame in comparison to the coin these fine fellas made earlier this year. Still pretty cool!

2025 RSO Malabo coin

That Ceiba tree is a pretty neat touch!

2025 MSG Yaounde coin

This is probably the coolest coin yet! That sword comes off from the coin. Some young marine had a terrific time designing this. We’ve already bought a bunch of these to gift to friends and family.

2024 MSG Yaounde coin

Reunification monument and the lion - Prominent icons from Yaounde.

2024 Seabee AF coin

Pretty neat representation of the Big5 in Africa

2024 RSO Yaounde coin

Coat of arms of Cameroon.

2024 MSG Mexico City coin

Some neat design in here!

2024 MSG Mexico City 249th Marine ball ticket

This was M’s exchange. We decided not to go to the Marine ball this year. However, we exchanged our cool 2023 Marine ball mug for this one. Pretty neat idea!

2024 Seabee WHA coin

The Captain’s wheel

2024 MSG Managua coin

Let’s talk rectangle.

2024 MSG Matamoros coin

I believe this one along with the remaining 5(?) combined form a mega mexico coin. Didn’t get around collecting the rest.

  1.

2023 Seebee Mexico City coin

A coin with a purpose. Love the ESC/ESO touch.

2023 RSO Matamoros coin

Gotta thank Rob for this one!

2023 RSO Mexico City coin

Pretty simple coin with the omnipresent Calavera! I believe the nine stars represent the nine consulates in Mexico.

2000 DOS Calcutta Consulate coin

  1.

entry.title: Code Snippets
entry.content:
Just a bunch of snippets for easy use elsewhere.

Building JSON output for posts with certain tags

{{- $tags := (slice "hiking" "add-other-tags") }}  <!-- Replace with your desired tags -->
{
    "play": [
        {{- $articles := .Site.RegularPages }}
        {{- $filteredPosts := where $articles "Params.tags" "intersect" $tags }}
        {{- range $index, $item := $filteredPosts }}
        {
            "date": "{{ $item.Date.Format "2006-01-02" }}",
            "emoji": "",
            "eventname": "{{ $item.Title }}",
            "link": "{{ $item.Permalink }}"
        }{{ if ne (add $index 1) (len $filteredPosts) }},{{ end }}
        {{- end }}
    ]
}

Read json data

Assumes json file is in assets/data/

{{ $p := printf "data/jsonfile.json" }}
{{ $data := dict }}
{{ with resources.Get $p }}
    {{ $data = . | transform.Unmarshal }}
{{ else }}
    {{ errorf "Unable to get resource %q" $p }}
{{ end }}

// Use jsonify to convert the data to a string
const jsonData = JSON.parse(`{{ $data | jsonify }}`);

entry.title: Colophon
entry.content:
Over time I’ve incorporated quite a few moving blocks to bring this site to function the way it does. This page is an attempt to document those various facets. See sitelog for chronological updates made on this site.

Publishing workflow

I use the fabulous Markor app on my phone to draft posts on the go. Syncthing runs in the background to sync posts to my laptop. If the laptop is turned on, HUGO running via docker automatically picks up these new posts, a script builds the site, and then pushes these updates to github. To draft posts on the laptop, I use the Remarkable app. My templates directory in debian has pre-built templates for long and short articles which I can easily copy over when drafting posts on the laptop.

Daynotes/Quicknotes

Overtime I realised I’d like to document certain days more. On such days I just jot down my thoughts on the markor app and let it sit there until I have access to my laptop. These get synced automatically say after a trip or at the end of the day and get published. This gives me the flexibility to associate my thoughts with a specific physical location without live-posting. An added benefit of these quicknotes is that each paragraph for a specific day is permalinked.

Comments

I moved away from ISSO and setup my own custom comments system. Comments when submitted on posts and certain pages, now get pushed to my ntfy.sh server. There’s mild spam detection in place.

At some point I would also like to integrate webmentions and pingbacks. The guts are ready but I haven’t seen the push to blend them in yet.

Garmin

I manually fetch the GPX files and summary from my Garmin account as needed. These are saved in the assets and static folders. If a specific post has front-matter set to point to those filenames, it shows an overlay of the stats on the gpx map. See this post for example. Also a Garmin page shows the summary of all activities. Could tweak this to show totals for a year etc. which I have not gotten to yet.

Rewind

I built the Rewind page to coax me to read my older posts. In every build, this page essentially loads all posts within three days of the current date in the previous years.

entry.title: State of the Network
entry.content:
Last updated: Wednesday, 17. September 2025 09:47PM

Twice every year, I used to update the state of my self-hosted network. Decided to switch that over to this page so it’s all in one place.

Since moving to Yaounde, I migrated and consolidated all my ‘servers’. Currently I’m using the NUC as my primary ‘homeserver’ and the Dell Inspiron 3000 as my Nextcloud server. The Odroid XU4 plays the role of a reverse proxy powered by Caddy. All these devices are bridged by Tailscale.

VPS => Odroid XU4 => NUC

I host the following applications on the NUC:

  • Trilium Notes
  • Navidrome
  • GoToSocial
  • Firefly iii
  • Calibre
  • Stirling
  • Linkding
  • Miniflux
  • NTFY
  • Etherpad
  • Wallabag

entry.title: Sitelog
entry.content:
Sort of a change log to keep track of modifications done to this portal.

Sunday, 18. January 2026 11:52PM

  • Added atom feeds for ‘sections’

Wednesday, 05. November 2025 10:29PM

  • Added some PESOS for mastodon conversations. Leaving the fetch manual for now.

Sunday, 26. October 2025 09:33AM

  • Fixed the photos page to show images from daynotes folder too.
  • Added minor css tweaks.

Sunday, 19. October 2025 10:20PM

  • Finally added that about page! Can’t believe it took me 20 years to do that.

Monday, 29. September 2025 10:11PM

  • Added a Wants page.

Wednesday, 17. September 2025 09:52PM

  • Added a SOTN page for my selfhosted setup.

Saturday, 13. September 2025 10:06PM

  • Added a uses page.

Saturday, 16. August 2025 11:02AM

  • Minor CSS tweaks to the gallery
  • Setup the Stamps page.
  • Setup the Coins page!

Friday, 15. August 2025 01:18PM

  • Added functionality to display images in Daynotes!
  • Reworked how the Micro page loads images.

Sunday, 03. August 2025 01:17PM

  • Updated the Map page to reflect posts on a map using the location taxonomy. This was fun.
  • Tweaked micro page to show a limited number of posts. Also fixed the issue of images overflowing into the text. Posts with galleries are yet to be fixed.

Sunday, 20. July 2025 10:17PM

  • Removed “micro” from showing up in the tags on the Daynote page.
  • Added a tiny note for all Daynote posts flagging the spontaneity.

Sunday, 01. June 2025 11:43AM

  • Tweaked my comments code and added a minimal implementation of webmentions. Thanks to Reilly Spitzfaden’s note.

Sunday, 25. May 2025 10:21PM

  • Migrated most of my ’tweets’ into this site. Ain’t neat but does the job!

Saturday, 24. May 2025 10:57PM

  • Migrated ‘most’ of my bookmarks or notes from my old ‘Known’ instance into this portal.

Tuesday, 20. May 2025 10:17PM

  • Tweaked the rss feed for tags and categories. Opted to remove the title and show only the date as the title. This should help feed readers like micro.blog properly digest the content in. Maybe?

Saturday, 26. April 2025 09:33PM

  • Collapsed menu for smaller screens. Thanks, Eakan!

Friday, 25. April 2025 11:39PM

  • Now displaying ‘person’ and ’location’ tags along with the regular tags for all posts.

Monday, 07. April 2025 09:40AM

  • Fixed RSS feeds
    • Excluded sections from feeds. Quicknotes should no longer show up in the regular feed.
    • limited to recent 8 posts

Thursday, 03. April 2025 10:46PM

  • Tweaked post display for person pages.

Tuesday, 11. March 2025 04:47AM

  • Started defining location and person frontmatter parameters in posts. These are currently being shown only on the daynote page.

Sunday, 23. February 2025 11:25PM

  • Added Daily Notes to this portal. Essentially a place to quickly jot down notes throughout the day. A loose replacement to DayOne?
  • Tweaked Lifemap so it renders a bit better on smaller screens.

Saturday, 15. February 2025 01:21PM

  • Added a Lifemap page and a Code Snippet page.

Tuesday, 04. February 2025 10:21PM

  • Disabled ISSO and setup a custom comments framework.

Saturday, 01. February 2025 07:11PM

  • Brought in the book notes from the old site. Not much but a placeholder for future notes.

Saturday, 25. January 2025 10:20PM

  • Incorporated a way to show both the gpx map and garmin data summary in one visual block.

Friday, 24. January 2025 04:18PM

  • Added a More tab to collect all the random pages that I’ve created in the past.
  • Moved the comments under a button for lazy loading.

Friday, 17. January 2025 12:39AM

  • Added posts count on the archive page
  • Added a quasi-firework display for posts tagged “Year End notes”. Currently only works starting 2024.

Saturday, 11. January 2025 11:16AM

  • Migrated site to Github. Might have to modify my posting workflow a bit.
  • Fixed images not showing up on the micro tab. Looks like the rel-url was getting copied over and my layout wasn’t accounting for that. Decided to extract the url from the image file itself and displayed it in the post.

Monday, 06. January 2025 11:50PM

  • Added gzip compression to the Caddy Reverse proxy block
  • Added WAF rules in cloudflare to block useless bots.

Dec 2024

  • Build roadmap for Garmin posts migration
    • Fetch activity summaries over as an archive
    • Build a yearly summary per activity
  • Add webmentions to the site. Thanks, Hugo!
    • Tweak CSS to display webmentions properly. Maybe explore this.
    • Maybe explore setting up an interactions content type like Jessica
  • Fix syndication issues
    • Limit RSS Feed fetch to just 5 recent posts
    • Make FrontMatter updates Camelcase proof
    • Consolidate into just one GO script
    • Figure out how to fetch synd links for micro posts without embed links1
  • Consolidate categories2
  • Convert old tweets to a summary page on this portal
  • Merge old instagram posts to the photos page3
  • Maybe add some pagination to the micro page
  • Migrate old PixelFed photos over.
  • Add a proper comment form for posts4.
  • Setup a script to autopost to GoToSocial.

Nov 2024

  • Used lonekorean’s fantastic wordpress-export-to-markdown tool to convert WP xml to markdown
  • learned that the hugo server and hugo build serve different purposes
  • Setup aliases on NUC and Thinkpond to quickly build and publish. Moved the actual publishing workflow to the Thinkpond and retained the main static site on the NUC.
  • Fixed permalinks to prevent link rot, almost?
  • Fixed RSS feed issues
    • For posts tagged as micro set the title to just date+time so that micro.blog picks it up as a note and not display the title.
  • Migrate older posts as deemed fit
  • Build a proper archive page. Made some decent progress, thanks to D’Arcy Norman’s, pointers here .
  • Build a proper photo gallery

  1. Decided to add a permalink to each post at the end. A shortcode automatically fetches the permalink and adds it to the end of each post. ↩︎

  2. Wrote a quick GO script to consolidate these ↩︎

  3. Moved the photos over. Decided to leave the photo notes behind. ↩︎

  4. Decided to use ISSO over Remark42 ↩︎

entry.title: I am Srikanth Perinkulam
entry.content:
And this is my digital playground.

This portal serves as my primary presence in the interwebs and is way more than a regular blog. If you’ve just landed here, welcome and feel free to poke around. Maybe you want to dive into my lifemap to visually see a few prominent events in my life? Or take a peek at my coins and/or stamp collection. If we’ve recently interacted, you might be featured on my interactions page! And then there might be a few more pages that might pique your curiosity.

Over the years, Ive distanced myself from mainstream social media, and this site has filled that void, allowing me to document lifes everyday ups and downs since 2006. Its a work in progress , so if you notice anything amiss, please do let me know. I refer to it as my playground for a reason!

If we’ve not met before:

Well, Hello! If you’ve read or seen something interesting on this site, I would be thrilled to hear from you. Actually even otherwise, send me a note. No, seriously DO! I try and respond to all emails and comments. Isn’t that what makes this web a beautiful place?

Since you are on this page, I guess I should talk a bit more about me - I am yet another random fellow traveler. Mountains, Family and Privacy matter the most to me. Somewhere I think I am a selfish hypocrite. Selfish for myself, my family and then the rest of the world - Specifically in that order. 1

I graduated with a Masters in Actuarial Science in 2015 from Columbia University and a Bachelors in Electronics and Communication Engineering in 2007. The former was probably my costliest and ignorant indulgence and the latter is why I have my current job.

Professionally, I think at the core, I am a generalist. I like to spread my net wide and my curiosity constantly take me in multiple directions. Over the last 18 years I’ve donned several diverse hats - Mainframes developer, Primary school Teacher, Consultant, Actuarial Analyst, Certifying officer and currently a Security Technical Specialist. I freaking love my current role and it is the reason why we are stationed in Yaound, Cameroon until 2027.

Four decades into my life and I still have a hard time pointing a location on the map to claim as home. And this lifestyle doesn’t make it any easy. I guess home is where my wife and daughter are. Someday I’d like to get a cabin in the woods somewhere in New England.

Get in touch:

If life got in the way and we lost touch, hit me up. I would love to hear from you. If you’re just intrigued by anything that was mentioned here or just want to say hello, I’d be thrilled to connect.

  1. You cannot take care of anybody unless you take care of yourself first - Something that was really driven home during a wilderness first aid training. ↩︎
